sentences.english: Students' self-pride will be injured by being laughed at.
sentences.chinese: 學生的自尊心會因被人恥笑而受到傷害。

sentences.english: Fear of ridicule at your expense might be one reason for rejecting help
sentences.chinese: 拒絕接受幫助的原因之一是害怕遭到恥笑。

sentences.english: If I calmly pocket the abuse, I'll be laughed at.
sentences.chinese: 如果我平靜地忍受這種辱罵，我會被恥笑的。

sentences.english: The window with red, pale look, laugh at life.
sentences.chinese: 倚窗伴月，淡望紅塵，恥笑今生。

sentences.english: You are determined to ruin him in the opinion of all his friends, and make him the contempt of the world.
sentences.chinese: 你決心要叫他的朋友們看不起他，讓天下人都恥笑他。

sentences.english: I have tried to prevent him from becoming the laughing-stock of the year.
sentences.chinese: 我設法使他不會成爲遭到大衆整年恥笑的對象。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
